pros: Good pay. Great people. Positive atmosphere.
cons: None. All good. No faults

pros:
Same reason to work for any healthcare provider, you're helping to make a difference to those in your community who need support.
Standard 25 days annual leave.
Good team to work in (usually) very caring group of people who do their best every day.
cons:
Impossible job to do, extremely overworked. Unable to keep staff happy due to high staff turnover. You spend your life begging colleagues to pick up shifts who often don't want to because they have lives outside of work and are already doing as much as they can.
Terrible pay for on call duties, and very little free time even when you're supposed to be off something happens and you're expected to work.
No support from upper management.
Unreasonable targets e.g. growth In hours delivered (more money for the people at the top of the chain) when you cannot cover the hours you already have. 
Really difficult to recruit new staff due to pay and benefits, you can earn more money working at a fast food chain or supermarket than you could being a healthcare assistant.
Difficult to progress once you progress into an office based role as the branches are so far apart and the company is forever being bought off by another company so jobs in head office are also not safe as the positions are constantly being merged. I personally worked for 5 different organisations over 11 years while remaining in the same employment.

pros: Nice collegues (the ones who are left)
cons: The business is in a constant state of decline.

pros: There are no pros working for this company
cons: Long hours for rubbish pay

pros: Making someone’s life better (clients)
cons: Feel forced to cover shifts , not good management, not paid enough, very inaccurate travel time

job_title: Disability Support Worker in Bangor, Gwynedd, Wales
pros: The job itself is great and working as a disability support worker is extremely rewarding.
cons: This is a minimum wage job. However, you have to take NVQ level 2 and pay to join a professional body. Sleep nights are paid at roughly a pound an hour less than minimum wage and there is no premium for wake nights which are paid at minimum wage.

pros: Flexible hours, great job satisfaction
cons:
Company dont give you the support you need.
Clients put on your rota with no notice, 
There is no couce for the carers.
Complaints are not followed up as they should be

job_title: Accountant in Hatfield, East of England, England
pros: some of the people were nice, it was a paying job
cons: poor management and no respect for the carers that actually provide the service. was not surprised to hear that it was going under and being sold off

pros: Most of the clients are lovely
cons:
Office is very unorganised.
They pay only 15p per mile

pros: A lot of shifts available
cons: low hour rate and fixed

pros: Always room to progress your career here
cons: Don’t take no for an answer

pros: They need you so there is work
cons: Poor pay never rises no matter how long you stay

pros: Regular work available Nice staff Flexible hours
cons: Low pay Bad communication changing of staff

pros: Caring for clients basic needs
cons: Terrible,rip off company, don’t care about their staff

pros: Job of care is a rewarding job.  Colleagues are very friendly and helpful -they will fill you in on the bits, the payroll staff will 'forget' to tell you.
cons: First off, wage is national minimum.  You're expect to complete all training unpaid, without any help towards expenses -this can take several months at high cost to yourself.  You're only given one top to wear, all extra you have to purchase.  Whilst shadowing you don't get paid for your petrol expenses, despite the high amount of travelling required.  They charge an admin fee on your pay slip.  -I've never heard of anyone other than Allied doing this.  You only get paid your hourly rate for time spent at a service users house. Time travelling, which may make up half your shift won't be paid for.  Once you're fully working for Allied, your petrol/diesel isn't paid per mile you travel, they give you a small payment per house, which doens't cover the travel costs.  Allied 'forgot' to tell me about these and I only found out when other employees informed me after I'd started.  I'm only writing this, so anyone looking to work for Allied as a carer, has an advance warning if they read this.  I have nothing against individual people there, but they need to be more honest about their pay structure and provide an adequate rate.

job_title: Health Care Assistant in Ebbw Vale, Wales
pros: Unfair pay, long hours for peanuts, no life working for allied
cons: Management don't care about staff or clients work you like a dog

job_title: Home Care Worker, Support Worker, Carer in Carmarthen, Wales
pros: If you are considering an early death  and trying to lower your self esteem and have a heart attack then this is the place to work
cons:
Where do I start! Bullying, intimidation, harassment. Being constantly harassed if lucky to have a day off, Not being paid the National Minimum Wage and expected to destroy your own personal vehicle for their benefit. worked for what equated to just over £3 an hour and mileage and nowhere near covers fuel, wear and tear etc on your car. Complaints and client concerns are routinely ignored and if you complain too much or are not in their elite clique then you are punished by withholding shifts but they keep you dangllng just enough to prevent you going somewhere else.
I am starting a case with an Employment Tribunal. Search online for Allied Healthcare regarding a nurse called ElaineFernandez. Their treatment of her was shocking and the sad fact is that it is commonplace in this company.AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE

job_title: Healthcare Assistant in Sunderland, North East England, England
pros: Better than being on the dole
cons: Management are hurrendous and unaccomodating.

job_title: Home Care Worker in Hemel Hempstead, England
pros: I had wonderful working relationships, with both staff and customers.
cons: As an experienced care worker I was horrified at the abuse and neglect I witnessed during my employment with Allied. Abuse and neglect I reported to management and senior management, only to find I was ignored and ridiculed, they simply didn't care or want to address issues raised. Zero hour contracts and their use by way of punishment and reward, blatant abuse of NMW regulations continually paying staff less by not paying for travel time and often no contribution for expenses mean staff turnover is huge. As good staff leave they are often replaced by people with little or no experience just to cope with demand, this is putting people up and down our country at risk of abuse and neglect in their own homes, I know because I have seen it! Allied are part of a huge private equity firm who seem run this country so not much chance of them moving away from care any time soon!

pros: The service users are all very lovely
cons: Having spent a bit of time at allied, I certainly wouldn't return or allow any family members to be covered by them, not at fault of the carers as they all do a fabulous job. Where to begin... the job was advertised at £13ph got my first pay slip 2 days work £84 at £7:20 an hour (only for the visits) travel time not included which is ridiculous as I spend more time in the car than I do with clients.. don't live in the area I cover and am expected to have two, two hour breaks, would rather have the visits and get paid than having to spend pointless time away from family. Clients all unhappy by the amount of changing faces there are due to short staff. Clients complaining that times of visits are forever changing. No continuity for clients seeing the same carer, especially those who would benefit such as dementia sufferers. Not enough training for new staff, expected to go out and practice stuff you've been shown in a 15 minute slot on a training course.

pros: Awful company take you on talk the talk at interview.but in reality nothing like what was said to you.promised 45ppm reality 15ppm doesnt even cover fuel costs let alone wear and tear on car doing 60 miles plus per shift using money from your own wages to cover fuel expenses.told guarenteed 30 hour contract.reality contact time only if your with a client 5 mins which sometimes happens as they dont need anything you earn about 35pence probably cost you that to travel to the client so not earnt anything in reality.told they will keep you local to your area but again reality is your expected to travel way out of your area again at your own expence as mileage rate doesnt cover fuel.clients are lovely shame the company cant be fair with its staff as could be a really nice job.let down by greed and not really giving a damm about the clients or staff.as long as the money keeps rolling in they dont care.training was good but nothing like the actual reality of the job.end result handed in my notice
cons: Sorry as above there are no pros to this job

pros: I have worked for the company for over 11 years and after a number of promotions I have moved from a branch position into a management position that I love at head office. I work in a great function with some incredibly talented people. Management have always been very supportive and we have a culture of promoting from within which is great.
cons: The care industry faces a lot of challenges which can make things difficult at times. The company has been through a lot of change over the years but is now very stable and is facing these challenges head on. There has been some brilliant progress in recent times with some fantastic things released, and with some even more exciting things ready to be launched in 2018. I think these will make a real difference and I can really see the company moving in the right direction.

review_title: This is the worst company i've ever worked at, too many top level managers who don't have a clue what they are doing.
pros: The Head office staff are lovely (most of them are, not the seniot managers or HR !) and most branch staff are too.
cons: The top level from Operations Director up that are horrible, most have NO indusrty experience and are mates of the CEO, in fact if you're friends with anyone in the Senior Management team you're more likely to get a job at Allied. The less healthcare experience you have the better it seems. The branch level make all the money and the senior people take it all, bonus are very rarely paid as goal posts are moved constantly.

review_title: Not easy but a great team
job_title: Coordinator At Out of Hours in Stafford, England
pros:
You work with some fantastic people.
A good chance to move into management after a few years, as everyone eventually leaves.
cons:
1. It is always understaffed due to the staff turnover, this lead to being so busy you cannot finish working on one emergency before having to take a call anyway. 
2. It was all about numbers and not actually about the patients and carers, Allied seemed to only focus on the profit.
3. The pastoral side of things could improve, when my mother unexpectedly passed they would keep calling me to see when I could come back to work (after a week.) I was 19 and clinically depressed, which they knew, so I had to be signed off for them to let me take time to heal, and that was not taken kindly.
4. The pay was so bad for such a busy and exhausting job.
5. Over-time is a must.

job_title: Care Assistant/Staff Nurse in Glasgow, Scotland
pros: Flexible shifts, but if you don't do what shifts you want they make it hell for you.
cons:
Really pretentious and paranoid staff that use 'emotional' blackmail tactics if you refuse shifts, despite me being on my final exams in Nursing, they still took the hump because I wouldn't cover a certain shift ON THE DAY OF MY EXAM!!

Very poor management, and beware they give thepublic holiday shifts to people who are part of their little 'clique' 

No ongoing support available, and training a lot to be desired.

Service Users always come FIRST!

Sending loners in to do jobs that are too dangerous, or just they are not trained to do unsupervised.

I worked here for 2 years, not once did I see a manager,  or any other person from your HQ,  or Care Commission.

No chance to progress if you are not part of their 'little clique'

Wages often wrong or late, which I have to spend all day to get sorted out.

review_title: Too big to be as agile as it needs to be
pros: Knowing the the outcome of the service helped people in their own homes.
cons: Senior management lack the ability to make a decision and stick with it. Employee engagement with the majority of the workforce who are actually out delivering a service is almost non existent. Trying to make changes and advances in the business is often delayed because of red tape, lack of IT competency or lack of engagement from staff and a general lack of co operative working. Turnover is higher than average which leads to delays in achieving things and the inability for staff to have confidence in where they are heading.

pros: lovely clients hard working carers .
cons: council made it compulsory we get paid now by the minute actually 12 p a minute we have no travel time were using our break time therefore nothing to eat all day .half hour call 3.60 if we leave after 10 mins its 1.20  20 mins 2.40  25 mins 3.00 thirty mins 3.60 so if we leave at 20 mins we get 2.40 council claim 1.20 clients get no refund greedy council sqaundered our tax money now clawing back  from vulnarable sick people and carers who work long and hard to keep them at home . concil carers  dont get paid by the minute of course talk about looking after your own shame on you Council ..

review_title: Love the job, HATE the company!
pros: Care work is so rewarding, and some of the clients and their families are fantastic
cons: Favouritism, taking work off one carer to give a favourite carer  more hours. Bodged up rotas,  pressurisation to work extra shifts, and work witheld if unable to accept,  terrible management communication, poor wages,....the list is endless

job_title: Carer in Saint Ives, East of England, England
pros: Non at all l am getting our of this job as quick as l can
cons:
You dont get Travel time at all. You are given 15mins slots on some calls it takes half an hour to get there. You pay an admin charge for all time sheets out of your wages.
Millage is not Paid. You lose money just working for this firm. I was given jobs and had to sit in my car for an hour waiting for my next call was not worth going home.

review_title: Laugh in your face in regards to the NMW
job_title: Health Care Support Worker in Swansea, Wales
pros: Service users and the other carers
cons:
Not paying the national minimum wage - The dont pay the actual travel time between calls, instead they pay an average time taken per mile between postcodes as advices by the AA route planner.
HMRC are well aware they are flaunting the rules and advise to speak to a Keith Knight at Allied who will correct your pay for you. 
Now struggling to get contact details for Keith, so looks like back to HMRC. 
Underpaid by £300 in 6 weeks, thats an extra £300 in the top bosses pocket.

review_title: Don't touch with a barge pole!!!
pros: Some of the clients are absolutely lovely, they make you feel like you're job is worthwhile
cons:
Everything! Nothing good to say about the shambles that is allied. Too many awful people in the office that have no idea what the other half of the office is doing. Rude and forceful office staff that penalise you if you can't 'fit' in that extra call! Office staff have no regard or respect for clients, they are just names on a sheet!! Steer clear is my advise!! They took away my love of caring!! Lied to constantly and declined furthering my training which was promised!! 
They told a clients wife to leave her husband in his chair for 24 hours without a pad change or move of position!! No respect or care!!

pros: Apart from the clients there are no pros at all
cons: constantly changing rotas even with half hour notice. forgetting about clients. no help at all from the office when something goes wrong. starting work at 06:30 am and finishing 22:20 lucky if you get an hour break all day. no support on going to a new client just told to read the book. pay is always wrong traveling time messed up and mileage never matches up. office is always contacting you on days off. being told you have to work more and more shifts. putting 2 runs a night on you. never come across office staff that are so rude unhelpful and so incompetent of their jobs. no care at all for service users or staff complete shambles just treated like slaves

pros: Clients were great on most part
cons:
They advertise with 8 GBP per hour. However, you're usually at a client's place for max 30 minutes and spend half the shift driving from one house to another and get paid just a couple of pennies 'mileage' for that. 

Very unorganised - called me everyday on my days off at 7am to ask if I can cover someone's shift. You feel bad saying no because elderly or disabled individuals rely on your help.

pros: Work with good people. Free coffee. Business easy to get to. For the area the money is quite fair.
cons: Virtually no possibility of advancement. Senior on site managers inflexible and not open to any form of discussion. Staff treated like serfs. Company is up for sale and call centre could close at any time. No information has been forth coming about sale of company, not sure is this is a deliberate policy or they just don't know.

review_title: I worked as a care worker for a while shocking conditions in this day and age
pros: None what so ever manager was full of self importance with shocking attitude towards care staff. Promised it all delivered nothing .
cons: Everything about the job was a con bad pay rate no fuel payments hours of work go from f/t to p/t  no steady shifts but plenty when it suited office staff who if your face fitted appeared you got more work thanks but no thanks I'd rather clean toilets than work for this company ever .

job_title: Out of Hours Call Coordinator in Stafford, England
pros: The pay is OK and the clients are lovely that you speak to.
cons: Worst company I have ever worked for. They treat the staff like absolute rubbish. So many people off with stress as they put far too much pressure on you. They don't care about employees well being and will drop you at a hat. Hours are awful, split shifts and 12 hour weekends. Managers constantly shouting there's calls waiting whilst your on the phone. If you don't answer a call within 10 seconds, your phone logs out and you get a disciplinary for call avoidance. Terrible place to work.

pros:
Lots of Overtime available due to staff shortage - mostly after 6pm and weekends 

Relaxed most of the year very busy bank holidays
cons:
Management never work full hours
No pay rises for over two years
Staff are treated with contempt 
Lots of back stabbing
Management always look to blame everything on junior staff 
Junior management made to do 3 people's jobs for low pay
No senior managers on site after 4pm or weekends

pros:
Service users are lovely and very grateful for your help.
Fellow carers for the most part amazing.
cons:
Office staff terrible; rotas never finished on time, treat their staff like the lowest of the low and expect the universe in return, vile to you if you cannot fit in extra calls, constant phone calls on days off and during booked holiday time, not at all understanding about illness. Not interested in assisting with return to work and take hours off you without warning.
The job is always advertised at £8+ an hour, actual pay is £7.20 or less.
Awful mileage pay and no time allocated to get between calls.

review_title: Already looking for a new job haven't even been here for 3 months
pros: Being able to help people feel more independent in their own homes
cons:
Too many to mention 
Not giving people enough time to move between homes therefore end up with no break
Failed to tell me it was a 0 hour co tract u til I had accepted the job and left my former job
Still waiting to be paid - office staff keep telling me they are going to sort it and never do

pros: Clients were great to work with, trainers were good as they were very compassionate.
cons: Staff in the office were bullies, denied payment of mileage if you put yourself out. No understanding of the clients of their needs and not understanding if you needed a break. Some of the carers had no or lack of compassion, and lack of working in a professional manner.

review_title: Crap - please go somewhere else if you value your sanity!
job_title: Home Care Worker in Wrexham, Wales
pros: Leaving to go back into mental health, it can't come quick enough for me!
cons: NO SICK PAY, NO MILEABLE although they state it. NO PENSION. employers have had no been paid whilst on holiday because of office errors. You may not get your breaks, toilet breaks and meal breaks too. Can be asked to walk between call and don't give enough time between calls too. Malicious gossip and bullying is conducted behind your back by your work mates. Manager says if you leave you will get a bad reference, so they've got you over a barrel.

job_title: Support Worker in Bury St Edmunds, England
pros: Rewarding job with lovely services users
cons: The office staff really need to pay attention to what clients needs are, if they looked after the carers properly like they promise while training us, we wouldn't leave the company and the clients wouldn't have to deal with new carers all the time, they want to have the same 2 carers all the time, good job but company not so great

job_title: Home Care Worker in Cardiff, Wales
pros: The clients are lovely, and so nice being able to support others with daily tasks that we take for granted.
cons:
Management are rude and unsupportive. 
Office staff don't listen, it's like talking to yourself.
Complaints are ignored, leading to neglect!
Have to make appointments to talk to office staff?? How is this a good supportive working environment? 
Staff lie to, your not asked to do something your told. Rotas are changed without even asking if it's ok. 
You harassed all the time when not in work!

pros: The clients are amazing, the carers are saints
cons: Wages, training, Working conditions, travelling so many miles, No travel time allocated at all between clients, misleading and false advertising with hourly rate, Sending out untrained or incompetent staff- there will be a serious accident one day!

pros: The office environment in Stone was the best in which i have ever worked. On the job training was given and the staff were really nice.
cons: There were zero travel opportunities for people based in Stone. The salary was poor. There was very little overtime on offer should it be needed.

review_title: Worst company I have ever come across
pros: None can’t think of anything, best thing would be to shut the company down and start again, with different senior leadership team of course as they need to go.
cons: Directors are useless at their job, they milk the company and put forward stupid expensive ideas no wonder the company is not doing well. They have no caring nature at all which is ironic seen as though they are a ‘care’ company. Communication in the business is non existent and they are totally unprofessional.

review_title: Service users were always bottom of the agenda
pros: Made good friends, flexible shifts to fit in with university,  lovely service users
cons: Poor management,  promised pay rise which never happened!, no mileage, no travelling time,  no support or empathy from office staff, not paid for training and lack of communication

pros: They will give anyone a job. Too many contracts to fill, so it doesnt matter if you are can do the job or even if you care but if your looking for work theyll give you a job just to cover their calls. The clients suffer but thats not an issue for Allied, as long as the money keeps rolling in.because of their size as a company this is the only advantage they have.
cons: Unsuitable and incompetent staff at higher levels who dont care what is going on at ground level. Write a complaint and NOTHING is done to address the problem --- but of course official process is followed and lots of papaerwork written up-- conclusion is its always the client being difficult. Branch colleagues all best friends and have their few favourite carers whi can get away with muder, had to leave as the company and branch managers have no morals. Will lie, manipulate records so they can pass CQC checks. I would never trust these people with my family. Very low IQ staff in general and in higher positions. Dont know how they are keeping the company running.there lovely values on the walls and the website are there just for show, they are not followed.they are very good at talking the talk...thats it . Allied should have all its contracts taken away they do not deserve them.

job_title: Community Support Worker in London, England
pros: Some of the clients you visit genuinely are nice! they appreciate your time, what you do for them as most of the time its not very pleasant.
cons:
they are a DISGRACE!!! There are no con's!

Company - This company sells dreams during training! they do not care or look after their employees at all! they don't pay for travel time and often do not allow time for you to get to other clients ie. you have a call at 08:00-08:45 your next call will be from 08:45-09:00! 
they are more concerned with numbers and will often force you to take other shifts when you are already behind and already have a full day often returning home past 9pm! you hardly feel appreciated and they don't care that you are also a human being with personal commitment's

Staff - The staff are  VERY rude when you call, most lack simple understand and often try to pass the buck even if the person is not in they just say "they will call you back" the only exception when they listen is when you are stern and not a push over or in the case of a emergency that will evidently fallback on them! 
You are often left chasing them because your just left to get on with it, with little or no guidance. The payroll team are a disgrace they have often had me guessing why my pay is so low and when I have enquired the answer I get is "This person pays a different rate" so not only are they false advertising about the pay they are also no taking ownership and paying you rightfully what your owed. 
You will become a favourite if you are a yes person and when it comes to bank holidays they choose who will get double pay. 

I'm really horrified by this company and have been told numerous times to get them investigated!

job_title: Carer in Ashford, Kent, South East England, England
pros: None do not work for them, I have been a carer for many years and can say they Allied have led me up the garden path, after one week I was not happy with their lies and if you think the £8.00 something they are paying you is good then think again they take almost a pound of you for when you have holiday and dont get paid till the second week - always a week behind with payment this is to cover that , I was on £7.00 something but no petrol l fees paid for.
cons: They say that you will cover a 5 mile radius but this is untrue, i was told to go somewhere on my first day alone 8 miles away and then to another place 12 miles away from my home. I then had to go back  to and fro these two places 5 times I got home at 2 a.m.  I left my home at 3.30 p.m. For 10 and a half hours I got paid for five hours work, thats if I get paid! I had worked earlier in the day too to places nearer but this was taking the p... my first day and given such a round  unfamiliar to me and way out of my area I got lost was tearful and lost in the dark it was a nightmare and why I said I didnt want to work for them. They didnt give you enough or any time to get to calls and clients would say your late.  It was a not as I expected and they dont tell you that most calls are for half an hour only!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Hythe, Kent, South East England, England
pros:
Most (but not all) of the carers were friendly, helpful and compassionate people who genuinely wanted to make a difference. 
Caring for another human being in need was very rewarding.
cons:
The company would pretty much hire anybody off of the streets. There was a time that I gave in a written report to management because one of the "carers" was being a malicious bully toward other carers and would swear and shout in front of the clients, which was very unprofessional, to say the least. Management did absolutely nothing about this person and repeatedly ignored my inquiries about the outcome of my report and if action had been taken.  

WARNING: clients are not safe or secure with this company. Steer clear at all cost! They do not have a clients best interest at heart. its all about fitting in as many clients as possible in as little time as possible. It's all about the £££ to them.   
The same message goes to the carers; this company will chew you up, spit you out and have you replaced before you have left the door. They are constantly short staffed and having to hire new staff because nobody can stand the company for any length of time once they discover the truth for themselves. 

It's sad to say but every single one of my clients held a grudge with the company (Allied) due to the way that it was run and would voice there concerns to me on a regular basis. In the beginning I would contact Allied with the clients concerns but to no avail.   

CARERS are also NOT SAFE or protected with this company and here's just one good reason why:
Carers were verbally pushed and repeatedly sent into a clients home, by the supervisor, when she knew full well that he had guns and hunting knives under his bedding were he lay and was prone to violence. The supervisor just laughed it off and said that it's fine to go in there.   

They rarely give travel time between each job and if they did on occasion it was never enough.  
Petrol paid for is minimum at 24p per mile. Most places pay 45p per mile. 
They are legally required to pay travel time, which I never once received despite my many messages to management.  

My wages were short on a regular basis, which meant I was having to spend my own private time sorting through pages of paperwork to pin point the exact calls I had not been paid for only to contact them each time and have them tell me that I was wrong. After a drawn out debate and system research they would finally agree that I was owed money but would make it seem like I was making a fuss about nothing saying "Oh yes, I see you were not paid for 3 calls but its only £ (whatever amount it was). It will be in your next wages. Sometimes it would be and sometimes it wouldn't. and then I would have to go through the same drawn out process again.

review_title: Making me ill, Bullying, victimizing, intimidating company,
pros: None what so ever, a ppalling
cons: They dont give a dam about their customers or staff, all they are focused on is getting anyone and anybody to cover shifts. I have now been intimidated for the third time by Management, This will be the last time they bully me as i have a legal team involved, Stand up for yourselves that what i have to say,

pros: Clients , staff helpful , rewarding job
cons: Early start , late finish -  long day

job_title: Health Care Assistant in Devizes, England
pros: Devizes branch absolutely fabulous to work for...I was new to care and I loved​ it. Only left due to moving.
cons: No cons like I said I loved my time working in the Devizes branch

review_title: Not a very nice company to work for treat the carers with no respect at all
job_title: Care and Support Worker in Abergavenny, Wales
pros: Meeting new clients everyday and not stuck in one place
cons: A lot of traveling wear and tear on the car long hrs gor very little pay

job_title: On Call Customer Service Assistant in Birmingham, England
pros: Most carers were great! Clients were always pleasant
cons: Branch staff usually left us with calls to cover. We would have to hound carers to take on extra work- usually with no incentive! Trying to get hold of branch on call during the out of hours period difficult - most did not care that clients were not receiving their calls - some were borderline rude.

pros: Loved my branch colleagues
cons: Disgusting treatment from a HR department who have MO respect for employees. They have no people skills whatsoever.

review_title: Been here 6 years on and off.
pros: Flexible hours, decent wage compared to others in the area, my availability is stuck to.
cons: Sickness is high. People get away with it!

review_title: The best job I have had
pros: I work for Devizes branch and the quality of care and training and support from the office and management is top class, I am very happy to reccomend Allied to anyone.
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Will take time out to listen to any concerns. Will support to cover work if you can't work
cons: Can make mistakes with your rota. But does get sorted if you call.

pros: Not bad to work for, met some lovely people and cared for some great characters
cons: 0 Hour contract, hours went from an average of 30- 35 down to 18

pros:
Good benefits, brilliant team atmosphere.
National Company and individuals can transfer if relocating. Have many experts in different parts of sector.
cons:
Internal barriers and do not separate Welsh legislation to English.
Some managers have lost sight of what is important.

job_title: Community Carer in Luton, East of England, England
pros:
Flexable
Weekly pay
Have few sit calls.
cons:
Manager wanting u to do more than ur available
Back to back calls
Not given client info before goin to client call.cic
Told wen start nvqs but still no sign.

pros: None whatsoever that I can think of
cons: The whole company is awful and should be forced to stop providing care

pros: The carers, they are the only pro
cons: Poor wage, working over contracted hours with no pay, no respect, treated like animals and demanded to do everything, management don’t do anything just tell everyone else tk do their dirty work. Company sent me my P45 whilst I was off with anxiety and depression due to their work environment

pros: Nice clients, uniform provided. Fairly flexible
cons: Management ignore all emails, no id provided, sent out to work alone before all shadowing hours completed.came across one client who was being dealt with "on the side". Care coach told me to ignore a client who asked me to do a job for her. Another client had mouldy butter which had been ignored. The office staff are utterly appalling, don't work for them

job_title: Home Care Worker in Airdrie, Scotland
pros: Lovely clients who are so grateful for your help
cons: Everything...hours...constantly on phone changing your run, adding extra clients, asking for overtime and being nasty when you refuse!! No pay for travel time...awful awful awful

pros: Very professional and caring.  Great incentives.
cons: Shortage of care workers, we need loads more.

review_title: Flexible but not great without own car.
pros: Very flexible hours and fair wage. Very good induction.
cons: If you do not have own transport it can be tricky getting to and from jobs. Travel is not paid to and from.

pros: Looking after lovely people, allowing them to stay in own home
cons: Terrible hours, bad management, constantly on phone for extra hours, then not happy when you refus

pros: All staff are friendly and out going
cons: Working on Minimum wage and low fuel pay

pros: Your clients are elderly and grateful for your help
cons: Too many hours to make a decent wagr

pros: met some lovely clients who desperately wanted time to talk...and couldn't have it due to the 20 mins in/out regime bad bad bad
cons:
after I left they lied verbally to my new employer alleging I walked off shift, gave no notice ect.....lucky I kept all my emails....proved them liars
nasty vindictive shower to work for

pros: The clients make the job worth while.
